content.question: Which of the following free-body diagrams shows an object in equilibrium?

choices.label: The figure shows a free body diagram consisting of three arrows extending from the central points of a 4 by 4 grid. An arrow labeled F sub 1 extends 1 unit up and 2 units to the left. An arrow labeled F sub 2 extends 1 unit up and 1 unit to the right. An arrow labeled F sub 3 extends 2 units down.

The figure shows a free body diagram consisting of three arrows extending from the central points of a 4 by 4 grid. An arrow labeled F sub 1 extends 2 units to the left. An arrow labeled F sub 2 extends 2 units up and 2 units to the right. An arrow labeled F sub 3 extends 2 units down.

The figure shows a free-body diagram consisting of three arrows extending from the central points of a 4 by 4 grid. An arrow labeled F sub 1 extends 2 units to the left. An arrow labeled F sub 2 extends 2 units to the right. An arrow labeled F sub 3 extends 2 units up.

The figure shows a free-body diagram consisting of four arrows extending from the central points of a 4 by 4 grid. An arrow labeled F sub 1 extends 2 units to the left. An arrow labeled F sub 2 extends 2 units up. An arrow labeled F sub 3 extends 2 units up and 2 units to the right. An arrow F sub 4 extends 2 units down.

The figure shows a free-body diagram consisting of four arrows extending from the central points of a 4 by 4 grid. An arrow labeled F sub 1 extends 2 units to the left. An arrow labeled F sub 2 extends 2 units up. An arrow labeled F sub 3 extends 2 units to the right. An arrow F sub 4 extends 2 units to the left and 2 units down.

content.answer: The figure shows a free body diagram consisting of three arrows extending from the central points of a 4 by 4 grid. An arrow labeled F sub 1 extends 2 units to the left. An arrow labeled F sub 2 extends 2 units up and 2 units to the right. An arrow labeled F sub 3 extends 2 units down.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
